Description: Male terracotta figure fragment, probably from a rider. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core, abundant organic vesicles, common fine quartz, mica and white inclusions (shell?).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Simple hand-made rider, possibly copying 'Persian rider' types (see British Museum GR1888,0601.90). A number of similar examples from Naukratis are now in the British Museum (GR1886,0401.1468 and probably GR1973,0501.18 previously thought to be a seated dwarf in Bailey 2008), the Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA599), Bristol Museum (H2223) and Bolton Museum (1966.93.A of unclear provenance). Parallels in Cairo Museum (unprovenanced TR14/1/34/6=SR5/1849; CG32901=SR5/1835; and from Toukh el Karenis TR14/1/34/5=SR5/1744). Higgins supplies GR1886,0401.1468 with a specific mid 4th century BC date (Higgins 1954, 407) and suggests this was made in Naukratis. However the Persian rider parallels probably date from 525BC to 400BC (see British Museum GR1888,0601.90). The fabric is consistent with Nile Delta kiln products of this period. More complicated examples with a mould made Persian style rider that are common at Naukratis (British Museum GR 1888,0601.90, Cairo SR5/ 966, CG 32804, Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA602, NA603, NA604), Tanis (Dunand 1990, 215-6, nos. 583-592 and 594-595), Memphis (Cairo SR5/6260; Petrie 1909a, pl. 40. nos. 42, 45, 46; Petrie 1909b pl. 29), Tell Basta (Cairo National Museum CG32810 SR5/967), Tukh el- Karamus (CG32806 JE35660 SR5/895), Deir el Bakari (CG32807 JE36203 SR5/896, CG32808 JE36203 SR5/897), Alexandria (Fischer 1994, nos. 20-21) and without provenance (Cairo National Museum SR5/970 CG32907, ST5/969 CG32904, TR22/11/22/1 SR5/906, TR22/11/22/2 SR5/907, TR22/11/22/3 SR5/908, C32902 SR5/898). Dunand, F. 1990. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte. Paris Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch- römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth. Petrie, W.M.F. 1909a. Memphis volume I. London: School of Archaeology in Egypt. Petrie, W.M.F. 1909b. Memphis volume II. London: School of Archaeology in Egypt.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.253) (Phase 1)
